New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers became only the fourth team in NBA history to win 15 straight games to begin a season.
Kenny Atkinson broke a league record with 15 wins to start a career with a new team.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland led the Cavs with 25 points, 12 assists and five rebounds, while Ty Jerome added 24 points and Evan Mobley put up 23 points with 11 assists.
Mobley had the play of the night when he blocked Hornets forward Brandon Miller’s dunk attempt with two minutes remaining.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers are proving night after night this start isn’t a fluke. They are a rising power in the NBA.
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland had four players score at least 20 points each of the last two games.
Coach Kenny Atkinson cautioned that they’re shooting above their heads and eventually the numbers will stabilize.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers scored 72 points in the first half and led the entire game.
The team is creating wide-open looks — and they’re making them with a drive/kick/swing offense.
Cleveland leads the league in 3-point shooting percentage and entered Sunday shooting 50 percent on wide-open 3s.
Others: The Cavaliers' next game is its biggest test: A Tuesday road game against the defending champion Boston Celtics in the NBA Cup.

The team is getting into their actions quicker, they’ve dramatically increased the cutting, screening and passing from last year and have shooters in the corners, multiple playmakers and elite ball handlers.
